item.description:
DJÄRV ··· Scandinavian Concert & Dance
Sunday, January 11, 2009 3:30 PM

St. John's Methodist Church
80 Mt Auburn Street, Watertown
(781) 862-7837

Djärv is a young Swedish quintet, playing vigorous and heartfelt traditional folk music with both jazz and pop influences. Together, the five members have created a homogeneous, vivid sound which has, over a short period of time, established Djärv on the folk music scene. Rooted in several different musical traditions, Djärv offers a varied stage performance where vocal, five-voiced tunes blend in with energetic dances and free improvisations. Their concerts have been broadcasted several times, both on Swedish national radio and abroad. The band has toured Europe extensively over the last three years.

Band Members
Markus Gustavsson - Fiddle & vocals
Joel Hagen - Flute & soprano saxophone
Harald Nilsson - Guitar & vocals
Anders Bergsten - Upright bass & nyckelharpa
Tobias Hedlund - Percussion

The show starts with a concert. During intermission, the band's nyckelharpa (keyed fiddle) player and two local players, Matt Fichtenbaum and Bronwyn Bird will discuss the instrument with those interested. After the break, there will be a Scandinavian dance with instruction. Wear comfortable shoes with soft soles to protect the wooden floor.

Advance price: $17
At the door: $20
Children 12 & under half price

MUSIC FOR ROBIN
Contact: Billie Hockett
Phone: (781) 862-7837
bhockett@music-for-robin.org
http://www.music-for-...
item.how_to_find_us: Ask Billie, she'll know where I am.
